titleStmt.title: Joseph W. Sanders to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10394

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Edmondson County Ky
Hon Mr Beriah McGoffin Governor of Kentucky
Your excellency.

Your humble Petitioner Joseph W Sanders would respectfully state to your Honor, that a fine of $60 was assessed against him at the March Term of the Edmondson Equity and Criminal Court 1861. for selling whiskey. by the quart. &C,, Your petioner would beg leave to say at the time he sold the whiskey, he was in bad health and had been some length of time previous, and further your petitioner states that he did not buy and sell with a view of violating the law in ^any^ way whatever, some of the Visitors told ^me^ that I had a right to sell by the quart. &C, Consequently done so, and thereupon came into Open Court and Confessed Judgement. Your humble petitioner is a very poor man, having a Wife and family depending on me ^for^ a Support, also destitue of means in the ad midst of the pressure of money matters,, whereupon Your humble Petioner petitioner prayes your clemency to be extended towards him in in this time of great distress,, and trouble,, I remain your humble servant. most Respectfully
We the undersigned unite in the prayer of the aforesaid Petioner.

James Lock
J. H. Baker
Stroud vanmeter
John. J. Shively
W. Harrel
D. M. Baldwin,
Samuel Wilson
Thomas
Thomas Merideth
W P S Arnett
Tiler. caroll
g Mc Hagan

Edmonson
E & C Ct
$60 } Tipling
Jos W. Sanders
Respd 12 mos
Issd Apr 9. 1861
